main event: A bright flashing light or object at 40 mhz was observed at very high altitude, traveling at a speed of 130 degrees per second on a course of 130 degrees.
interesting points: The object was observed by ground radar, but echo data was not available.
The object could not be definitively identified as a satellite due to insufficient data.
The sighting was reported to multiple military and government agencies, including NORAD and the Air Force.
The object was described as as bright as a second magnitude star.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were calm with scattered clouds.
